modName: Journal of Jastheria - Racy Tales of a Redguard Con Woman
summary:
You've found a small journal that begins: "I'll say this for your average Nord. Even at the depths of their most drunken haze, they usually understand that 'No' means 'No.'

Etienne, however, was no Nord. Nor was he truly drunk. I'd seen him drunk, and he never got that loud...."

This i
descriptionHtml:
[color=yellow]Journal Mod[/color]
This short-story mod features the journal of Jastheria, a Redguard Expatriate and con woman.

[color=#ffe599][u][b]The journal sits on the hearth in the Sleeping Giant Inn at Riverwood.[/b][/u] [/color]

The first entry is titled [color=#00ffff]'Forgeries, Cleavage, and the Bloody Thalmor.'


[i][size=3][b]"I’ll say this for your average Nord. Even at the depths of their most drunken haze, they usually understand that ‘No’ means ‘No.’
Etienne, however, was no Nord. Nor was he truly drunk. I’d seen him drunk, and he never got that loud...."[/b][/size][/i][/color]


[color=#ff0000]ADULT CONTENT![/color] It's not insanely explicit, but you might want to minimize the screen if someone walks in. ;-)

If you liked the story, then please endorse! It's really the only feedback I get as to how well the work was received. If there's enough demand, I might do more!


[color=#ffff00]INSTALLATION:[/color]
Use the mighty Nexus Mod Manager.
OR!
Drop the ESP into your DATA folder.

PLEASE NOTE: This mod ONLY adds the journal. Jastheria herself is not part of this mod.
--The journal respawns on the normal timer.

ALSO NOTE: If you run across typos or other errors, let me know. I didn't run this through the usual rounds of editors, since those mercenaries always want money for their work. How dare they?? ;-)


[color=#ffff00]UNSINTALL:[/color]
Delete the ESP from your DATA folder.


[color=yellow]SAVEGAMES[/color]
Two saves are available.

Both saves start with Jastheria freshly arrived in Riverwood. She's still level 1 with a bit of sneak and lockpicking.

The first save is Jastheria with the main questline ENABLED. In my stories, Jastheria is not the Dragonborn, but this is your safest mod, since I don't know what long-term effects disabling the main questline has.

The second save is Jastheria with the first act of the main questline COMPLETED (so you can buy Breezhome, etc...). You're supposed to talk to Delphine to continue the quest line. As long as you don't ask her about the Thalmor, she'll still run the Sleeping Giant Inn, you've got the key to her secret room, and you're right about where my story will pick back up, if I write more.

WARNING: I have no idea what force-completing the first act might break out there in the world. I strongly recommend just using the first save with the main quest enabled, and just don't follow up on it if you want to play Jastheria as 'canon'.

Both saves have her equipped with a fair amount of loot from her time in Solitude. Her actual adventuring gear is stuff I picked up in Helgen when I made the save. Story-wise, Delphine gave her some salvaged gear to get her started on the road to Riverwood.

NOTE: Both saves are pretty clean. Please see the credits below for the list of mods that will keep Jastheria looking as gorgeous as her screenshots. If you don't use those mods, she'll still look pretty damn good, but will be different, obviously.


[color=#ffff00]SAVE INSTALLS:[/color]
To install, drop the .ESS into your Skyrim saves directory. This is usually at:
Documents\my games\Skyrim\Saves


[color=#ffff00]SAVE UNINSTALLS:[/color]
Delete the .ESS files.


[color=yellow]FUTURE BUILD:[/color]
I envision Jastheria as an unarmored melee sneak. She starts out using light armor but switches to cloth when her Alteration gets to the Mage Armor level. And, while she doesn't know any magic by the end of my first story, Delphine teaches her a thing or two, and she will eventually master Illusions and Alteration.

For combat she prefers to dual wield. She'll sneak in, open with an assassination, then swap to swords (or axes or maces) and get to work. Using illusions, she never fights alone. She'll sow as much confusion as possible with AE Fury and Fear, preferably before she's discovered.

And, of course, she's a first-class con woman. She can talk anyone into anything.

It would seem Nexus doesn't like IGN"s insanely long build links. So, here's a quick breakdown:

Alteration - Whole tree except dual cast.
Illusion - Whole tree except dual cast.
One hand - Everything except the weapon-specific talents. Pick one of those, if you wish.
Sneak - 1/5 Stealth, Backstab, Deadly Aim, Assassin's Blade. No other talents.
Lockpicking - Tree trunk up to Master Locks. Branch into Quick Hands, Golden Touch, and Treasure Hunter.
Speech - Whole tree.
Enchanting - Whole tree except Soul Squeezer and Soul Siphon.


[color=yellow]ABOUT THE AUTHOR:[/color]
I'm a professional writer and avid gamer, currently working full time for a miniatures wargame company as their head writer. You can find more of my work here: [url=http://wrathofkings.com/]http://wrathofkings.com/[/url]  

To see the latest novel for that particular game, go to Downloads -> Novel and pick your eBook format (PDF available).


[color=#ffff00]PERMISSIONS:[/color]
Please don't upload this anywhere else without inquiring with me first, especially Steam. There's questionable language in their upload agreements. I still own my copyright, but it makes it sound like they can distribute this anywhere they want without asking me. Kinda not cool, and I'd rather avoid the issue entirely.


[color=yellow]CREDITS:[/color]
Thanks to Bethesda for Skyrim! A fun setting for all sorts of stories.

Meanwhile, Jastheria, has had more work done than Cher. The mods I used for the screens:

ApachiiSkyHair by apachii: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10168]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10168[/url]
CBBE by caliente: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2666]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2666[/url]
Custom Lighting Overlay by fLokii: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/11479]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/11479[/url]
Coverwomen (look 1) by MrLenski: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3563]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3563[/url]
DyanVision by Gopher: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/12525]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/12525[/url]
Killer Keo's Skimpy Armor and Clothes by killerkeo: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3654]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3654[/url]
Natural Eyes by nevenbridge81: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3589]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3589[/url]
Realistic Lighting by Plutoman101: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/7654]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/7654[/url]
Sporty CBBE by xs2reality: [url]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/13377[/url]

If I missed anyone, then apologies! Let me know.
author: EFKelley
